section.title: Definition
section.para: Creates an RPM containing appliance-specific images for the Anaconda installer, Red Hat Graphical Boot (RHGB), firstboot, GDM login screen and the GNOME and KDE display managers. The name of the RPM is $NAME-logos, where $NAME is taken from the value of the element.
This module is a member of the rpmbuild module group.
section.note: SystemBuilder requires additional software in order to use the logos-rpm module. To install a complete version of SystemBuilder including all available software, follow the instructions located at http://www.renditionsoftware.com/systembuilder/download.

listitem.para: BOOLEAN value indicating whether the logos RPM should use the default set of obsoletes in addition to those defined in its <obsoletes> elements.
The default set of obsoletes for the logos RPM is fedora-logos, centos-logos, redhat-logos, and system-logos.
See Also RPMBuild Common Element and .

Include in the logos RPM the necessary images and configuration files to completely replace the default branding for the selected desktop environments; "gnome" for GNOME or "kde" for the K Desktop Environment. The value "all" includes files for all supported desktop environments, while "none" doesn't include any desktop environment files.
The default text value for this element is "all".
The PATH to the logos XML configuration file referencing the custom image files for the client system.
If not specified, SystemBuilder uses a default configuration based on the base distribution of the appliance.
See for a syntax reference for this file.
This element can occur zero or more times.
This element can occur zero or more times.

informalexample.programlisting:
<logos-rpm> <!-- include user-customized images and configuration --> <logos-path>centos5-logos.xml</logos-path>
<!-- replace branding on GNOME only --> <include-xwindows-art>gnome</include-xwindows-art> </logos-rpm>
